description.narrative: The existing partnerships in Communication for Development between the Communication Section and Universities was expanded to include support to the XOne Primarily Health Per WardX strategic approach, monitoring and supportive supervision for facility-based and community-based service providers in 15 Schools of Public Health in Nigeria | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: of Community Dialogue sessions on Essential Family Practices

actual.value: 2015:Community Dialogue sessions focused on promoting Essential Family Practices, including Sleeping Inside Long Lasting Insecticide-Treated Nets, Attending Ante-Natal Care, Hand-washing at critical times and Immunization. 4,946 community dialogue sessions were conducted, reaching 13, 114 Males and 23, 2

2015:The formulation/reactivation of Mothers Support Groups has been a critical component of discussion and planning. 90 Mother Support Groups exist in 3 States (Kano, Jigawa and Adamawa), in 6 LGAs (Birniwa, Guyuk, Maigatari, Song, Sumaila and Tsanyawa).Zamfara, Kebbi, Katsina and Kaduna States are stil

title.narrative: Exclusive breastfeeding rate up to 6 months

actual.value: 2015:25%. Interventions and messages to support EBF are being implemented using multiple channels and media. The use of the Ureport platform has been particularly useful in contributing to the dissemination and monitoring of newborn and child health issues that are discussed and made publicly available
